meanings.definition: A group of dark-colored, double-chain silicate minerals.
meanings.sent1: The geologist found shiny amphiboles in the cave.
meanings.sent2: Miners often encounter amphiboles while digging for precious stones.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the amphiboles for shiny acorns.
meanings.sent4: The night sky sparkled like a bed of amphiboles strewn across the ground.
meanings.sent5: The amphiboles glistened in the sunlight, resembling tiny jewels.

meanings.definition: Any of a group of rock-forming minerals.
meanings.sent1: Amphiboles are commonly found in igneous rocks.
meanings.sent2: Hikers can sometimes spot amphiboles embedded in mountain formations.
meanings.sent3: The playful child arranged the amphiboles into a makeshift rock garden.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were as dark and mysterious as the amphiboles in the cave.
meanings.sent5: The amphobiles stood out against the dull rocks, like stars in the night sky.
